text:
Is there such a thing as a parametric job scheduler in HPC where you can say stuff like: If i get x nodes with Y RAM i will need f(x,y) time to complete?
Scheduling either task a with x1 nodes and y1 ram exclusive-or task b with x2 nodes and y2 ram xor ... would also work.
iirc there are a bunch of theoretical algorithms for that kind of scheduling, but I don't know of any that are actually in use because it's rare to have those numbers

You could sort of get this in Slurm by scheduling multiple jobs with the same name and using `--dependency=singleton` (then cancelling which ever job doesn't start)
